description: Change of use of single family dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to a 7-bedroom, 7-person House House in Multiple Occupation (Large HMO) (Use Class Sui Generis)
decision_conditions: The modifications to the host building shall be constructed as per the details set out in the approved plans. These modifications shall be commenced within three months of the date of this permission and completed to the Council's satisfaction within six (6) months of the date of this permission, otherwise planning permission will lapse.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 3.5 of the Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 16-19-07C (Existing Elevations, Floor Plans, Block Plan and Site Plan), 16-19-09P (Proposed Elevations and Floor Plans), 16-19-14 (Block Plan, Existing Outbuilding Elevations and Plans), 16-19-15A (Block Plan, Outbuilding Elevations and Plans), Planning, Design and Access Statement, Mesh Bike Shelter prepared by Cyclehoop, Timber Wheelie Bin Enclosure (WBE-1100-TWME).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Seven (7) cycle storage spaces shall be provided for the development in accordance with the location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first re-occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Refuse and recycling storage areas shall be provided for the development in accordance with the location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first re-occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021). | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be assessed with regard to the Council's standard in the SPG10 and noise limits of BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve criteria specified in BS8233:2014. The above shall be implemented prior to the re-occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the units in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site, when operating together at maximum capacity, shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10. | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10. | The use of the outbuilding shall not commence until the external door has been fitted with a self-closing device, which shall be maintained in an operational condition. At no time shall any external door nor windows to the outbuilding be fixed in an open position during the emission of noise or other emissions.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise and vibration, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and SPG10.
